title: 'Vital for Golden Dome': Trump's new reason for Greenland grab; pushes Nato for compromise
content: US President Trump advocated for the acquisition of Greenland, emphasizing its strategic importance for national security and promoting a new 'Golden Dome' defense initiative. He argued that Nato's involvement is crucial, warning that without US influence, nations like Russia or China could extend their reach.

title: Middle East on boil: US asks military personnel to depart bases; Iran issues warning
content: United States forces are repositioning from key Middle East bases. Tensions with Iran are rising sharply. This follows a crackdown on protests and threats of US military action. Iran warns of attacks on US bases if America strikes. Some personnel are advised to leave Qatar's Al Udeid Air Base. This is described as a posture change amid regional instability.

title: Musk's prediction: Tesla CEO makes 4 bold forecast on AI; puts doctors on 3-yr deadline
content: Elon Musk envisions a future where AI and robotics revolutionize healthcare, with specialized robots potentially outnumbering human surgeons by 2030. He also predicts retirement savings will become obsolete as automation drives down costs, and suggests human aging is a solvable problem, hinting at extended lifespans. Furthermore, Musk anticipates AI surpassing human intelligence within the decade.

title: Not Dhoni or Pant - KL Rahul becomes 1st keeper to achieve this feat
content: Rahul brought up his eighth ODI hundred in the 49th over by hitting Kyle Jamieson’s full toss for a six. He reached the landmark in 87 balls and remained not out on 112, scoring 11 fours and one six.

title: Trump who? At $1.2tn, China's trade surplus hits new high in 2025 - despite US tariffs
content: US-bound shipments did fall sharply after Donald Trump raised duties in 2025. But under Xi Jinping's guidance, Chinese exporters responded with speed and ingenuity. Sales surged instead to Southeast Asia, Africa, Latin America and Europe. In many cases, goods were routed through third countries, blunting the effect of US tariffs altogether.

title: 'Dynamite' diplomacy: Japan's Takaichi, South Korea's Lee Jae Myung in K-pop drum battle— watch
content: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi and South Korean President Lee Jae Myung shared a unique diplomatic moment, drumming to K-pop hits like BTS's 'Dynamite' and 'Golden' from 'K-pop Demon Hunters' in Nara.  The leaders expressed optimism for bilateral ties, with President Myung noting they "shared harmony atop our individual rhythms." The summit aimed to strengthen relations amidst regional tensions.

title: Amazon's RTO gets stricter: Managers tracking hours; three types of employees under scanner
content: Amazon is now closely monitoring office attendance, tracking not just presence but also exact hours spent by corporate employees. This escalation in surveillance, revealed by an internal document, flags 'Low-Time Badgers' and 'Zero Badgers' who don't meet in-office expectations. The move follows a strict five-day return-to-office mandate, with similar tracking systems emerging at tech rivals like Samsung and Dell.

title: The Mutual Fund Advisor: What really makes a mutual fund ‘Good’? It’s not last year’s return
content: A very aggressive small-cap fund can be a good satellite holding for a long-term, high-risk investor. The same fund is a terrible choice as a core holding for someone whose child’s college fees are 8 years away and who panics whenever the market falls 10 per cent.

title: From Chabahar to Kashmir: Why chaos in Iran hurts India, benefits China & Pakistan
content: India watches Iran's protests with unease, fearing a weakened state would disrupt its strategic environment. Iran serves as India's vital western corridor to Central Asia via Chabahar Port and a crucial counterweight to Pakistan's regional influence. A collapse risks jeopardizing connectivity projects and India's multi-alignment policy.

title: Did GrokAI generate sexualised images of minors? Here's what Elon Musk said
content: Elon Musk has taken a stand against allegations that Grok, X's AI chatbot, is involved in generating illegal naked images of minors. He emphasized that the bot only responds to user commands within lawful boundaries. Musk also acknowledged the risks posed by malicious prompt hacking and vowed to implement immediate corrections to these vulnerabilities.

title: AI ‘fantasy board’ for CEO, creates Steve Jobs, Warren Buffett avatars
content: MarkupAI's CEO, Matt Blumberg, has assembled a 'fantasy board' of 15 AI advisors, including digital versions of Steve Jobs and Warren Buffett, to enhance strategic planning and receive instant feedback. This innovative approach provides round-the-clock counsel, supplementing human board interactions and aiding in critical business decisions. Blumberg emphasizes this AI tool augments, not replaces, human expertise.

title: Mumbai BMC elections 2026: Full schedule, voting time and result date
content: As Maharashtra preps for essential municipal elections involving 29 corporations, the spotlight is on Mumbai where the BMC showdown between the BJP-backed Mahayuti and the united Thackeray coalition is making waves. On January 15, over 3.48 crore voters will cast their votes, choosing from 15,931 hopefuls. This pivotal election is underscored by strategic alliances and enticing offers targeting women voters.

title: Shaksgam Valley: India bristles over China's fresh claim - dispute explained
content: China's renewed claim over the Shaksgam Valley, an area India considers its integral territory, has reignited a strategic dispute. Beijing's defense of infrastructure construction, linked to CPEC, draws a sharp response from New Delhi, which rejects the 1963 China-Pakistan boundary agreement as illegal and invalid.

title: Harvard now hosts more students from China than India: A tale of 2 countries and 2 choices
content: Harvard’s Fall 2025 data shows a sharp India–China contrast inside one of America’s most elite campuses. China counts 1,452 students to India’s 545, with the widest gaps in GSAS, Design, Public Health and Medicine—research-heavy spaces where influence compounds over time. India’s strongest presence is in Business and near-parity at Kennedy, reflecting faster, career-linked routes.

title: 'We have our own ABD': SKY gets pat on the back ahead of T20 WC
content: Despite a lean run in 2025, India’s T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav has been backed strongly by Harbhajan Singh, who called him the “No.1 player in T20Is” and tipped him to shine at the World Cup. Harbhajan also expressed confidence in India defending the title, praised Virat Kohli’s impact across formats, and voiced concern over the lack of quality off-spinners in Indian cricket.

title: When thyroid goes untreated, the heart pays the price: Doctor shares symptoms and preventive tips
content: Thyroid issues, often overlooked, significantly impact heart health. Both underactive and overactive thyroids can lead to serious cardiac problems, including increased risk of heart disease, irregular heartbeats, and even heart failure. Early detection through simple blood tests and timely treatment can prevent these complications, emphasizing the crucial link between thyroid and heart well-being.

title: 'Leave Iran': India's stark advisory amid threat of US attack; protests spread
content: India has issued an advisory urging its citizens in Iran to depart immediately due to escalating regional tensions and internal protests. The advisory, released by the Indian embassy in Tehran, advises students, pilgrims, business persons, and tourists to leave by available transport, including commercial flights, amid concerns of potential US military action and reported fatalities from unrest.

title: LeBron James salutes Kyle Lowry with two-word message at Toronto homecoming
content: Toronto Raptors fans gave a heartfelt standing ovation to former star Kyle Lowry during his return, even as his 76ers team secured a win.  LeBron James lauded the touching sportsmanship with a social media post. Lowry, who spent nine years with the Raptors, called the moment a career highlight, cherishing the team's gesture.

title: Aamir Khan lost 18 kilos for ‘Happy Patel’, reveals diet details
content: Aamir Khan has shed eighteen kilos due to an anti-inflammatory diet adopted for health reasons, which has also significantly reduced his migraine attacks. He will appear in a comic cameo alongside nephew Imran Khan in 'Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos', clarifying it's not a comeback for Imran.

title: I never celebrate my birthday in India: US woman shares culture shock
content: Kristen Fischer is a travel blogger who has been living in India for the past four years. Kristen and her husband had come to India as travelers, and they fell so much in love with the country that they decided to move here permanently. In this article, she expresses a dislike for celebrating her birthday there due to cultural differences.

title: Army chief says Operation Sindoor still ongoing; forces monitoring every enemy move
content: Operation Sindoor, a swift 22-minute joint military strike on nine terror camps in Pakistan, remains active, with India maintaining vigilant surveillance. Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi highlighted this decisive response to the Pahalgam attack, showcasing India's readiness to protect national interests and sovereignty. The operation also saw veterans contributing to strategic planning.

title: Defaulter? Not me! Chandigarh man wins Rs 20K over credit blunder
content: A major credit card firm faces a hefty penalty after wrongly tagging a customer as a loan defaulter despite a 'no dues' certificate from 2007. The consumer was hounded with calls for unpaid dues years later. The Chandigarh Consumer Commission ordered the company to clear the CIBIL error and pay Rs 20,000 for harassment and mental agony.

title: Chhattisgarh shocker: Farmer attempts suicide after failing to get online paddy token
content: A tribal farmer in Chhattisgarh consumed pesticide after failing to secure an online token to sell his paddy.  Land and crop record errors, coupled with a halt in token generation, left him desperate.  The district administration has suspended a patwari and issued a notice to a tehsildar pending an inquiry into the incident.

title: Video: 'Anti-Trump' secret agent assigned to Vance caught leaking 'sensitive info'
content: In a shocking breach of security protocols, a US Secret Service agent tasked with safeguarding Vice President JD Vance has been put on administrative leave. This action comes after the agent allegedly disclosed top-secret details about protective measures to an undercover reporter masquerading as a romantic partner. Key insights shared included critical schedules, security arrangements, and travel itineraries.

title: IShowSpeed net worth timeline: How Darren Watkins Jr built his fortune
content: Darren Watkins Jr, known as IShowSpeed, transformed from a young gamer into a global streaming sensation. His earnings grew steadily from YouTube ads to music, tours, and brand deals.  Starting with minimal income, his net worth surged significantly between 2020 and 2026, reaching an estimated $35-40 million.  He maintains a private personal life.

title: Inside edge, bowled: Ahmedabad déjà vu as Kohli's dismissal mirrors 2023 WC final — Watch
content: Virat Kohli's dismissal in the second ODI against New Zealand echoed his World Cup final exit, losing his stumps to a delivery close to his body. Despite the early setback, Kohli achieved a significant milestone, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar to become India's highest ODI run-scorer against New Zealand. He now trails only Ricky Ponting globally.

title: AA 23 x LK7: Allu Arjun and Lokesh Kanagaraj’s film goes official
content: Pan-Indian superstar Allu Arjun officially teams up with acclaimed director Lokesh Kanagaraj for his 23rd film, tentatively titled 'AA 23'. This highly anticipated collaboration, featuring music by Anirudh Ravichander, promises a grand cinematic experience.  Following his massive success with the 'Pushpa' franchise, Arjun embarks on a new, exciting venture with Kanagaraj, known for his unique directorial style.

title: India Open: Ex-World No. 1 on criticism — ‘Every country has its challenges’
content: Kidambi Srikanth defended the playing conditions at the India Open, saying he faced no major issues and that minor problems occur everywhere. His comments came after Denmark’s Mia Blichfeldt criticised the venue. P V Sindhu also backed the facilities, calling the event a good trial ahead of the World Championships, while other players shared mixed but balanced views.

title: Run machine keeps ticking: Kohli breaks Tendulkar's record; achieves this milestone
content: Virat Kohli surpassed Sachin Tendulkar to become India's highest ODI run-scorer against New Zealand, reaching 1,773 runs. He achieved this milestone during the second ODI on Wednesday. Kohli's innings ended at 23, but he now sits second overall behind Ricky Ponting in this specific batting record.

title: Aaron Rodgers takes final dig at Jets in what may be his 2025 farewell
content: Aaron Rodgers has reportedly expressed immense gratitude for his time with the Green Bay Packers and Pittsburgh Steelers. His recent comments have led many to believe he does not feel the same about his limited tenure with the New York Jets. Cybercitizens have reacted to this supposed favoritism. Rodgers’ decorated career has spanned three NFL teams and 21 seasons.

title: 'Will boost military presence': Denmark hits back at US' Greenland threat
content: Denmark is bolstering its military presence in Greenland and boosting NATO's Arctic activities, responding to US concerns about defense. This move comes as Greenland gains geopolitical importance due to its location and proximity to Arctic routes. Copenhagen aims to reassure allies of its commitment to Arctic security and collective defense through NATO.

title: Stock market holiday: Why BSE and NSE are closed on January 15; what investors should know
content: Indian stock markets, including BSE and NSE, will be closed on January 15 due to municipal corporation elections in Maharashtra.

title: Goa raises Class 1 age to six: India slows school entry, but the real alarm rings in pre-schools
content: Goa has introduced the Goa School Education Bill, 2026 to make six the minimum age for Class 1 entry, aligning its law with NEP 2020 and the RTE framework. The move reflects a wider national push to slow down early formal schooling. But the real pressure point is pre-school: Studies suggest that quality and readiness remain uneven.

title: ‘When admitted to the hospital’: Iyer recalls ‘excruciatingly painful’ injury
content: Shreyas Iyer revealed he only realised the seriousness of his spleen injury from the Australia ODI after being hospitalised, calling the pain “excruciatingly painful”. The setback forced him to slow down and reflect. Following medical advice, he recovered well and returned strongly, scoring 49 against New Zealand while trusting his instincts and focusing on team balance.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection: Film crosses Rs 810 crore; does better than 'The Raja Saab'
content: Remarkably, 'Dhurandhar' continues its box office reign, outperforming new releases and even the Hindi version of 'The Raja Saab' in its sixth week.  The Ranveer Singh starrer has now surpassed 'Stree 2' as the highest-earning film in Week 6, showcasing incredible staying power and audience appeal.

title: $200,000 for palak paneer? Old US campus settlement explodes on social media
content: In a notable case echoing beyond academia, the University of Colorado Boulder has reached a $200,000 settlement with two Indian PhD candidates following a controversial incident involving palak paneer. The students claimed they faced discrimination due to food odors and an unwelcoming atmosphere stemming from a 2023 altercation with staff.

title: 500 stray dogs killed in Telangana villages in one week
content: Stray dogs were allegedly culled using lethal injections in Telangana's Kamareddy and Hanamkonda districts, with elected representatives reportedly fulfilling election promises. Police have registered cases against several sarpanches and others involved. Carcasses were exhumed for post-mortem examinations, and viscera samples sent for analysis. The Supreme Court also expressed concern over stray animal management.

title: The two clear paths the Steelers can take as they figure out life post-Tomlin: Barnwell on what's next
content: Mike Tomlin and the Steelers have parted ways. But will Pittsburgh now change its roster-building approach under the next coach? And who should replace Tomlin?

title: Morant on possible Grizzlies exit: 'Live with it'
content: Ja Morant says he has to "live with it" over the possibility of the Grizzlies seeking to trade him. He also told reporters he will "hopefully" play in a pair of games in Europe this week.

title: LIV signs Dustin Johnson to multi-year extension
content: LIV Golf has signed two-time major champion Dustin Johnson to a multi-year extension, the league announced Wednesday.

title: LeBron separates himself from agent's Reaves take
content: LeBron James cleared the air following the Lakers' 141-116 win over the Atlanta Hawks on Tuesday, separating himself from the opinion of his agent, Rich Paul of Klutch Sports, who said that L.A. should trade away fan favorite Austin Reaves.

title: Giannis boos fans back as Bucks drubbed at home
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo responded to boos from his home fans in kind, giving two thumbs-down to the crowd following an and-1 layup during Tuesday's blowout loss to the Wolves.

title: Sources: Mets offer Tucker in $50M AAV ballpark
content: Free agent outfielder Kyle Tucker has been offered a short-term deal by the Mets that is believed to be worth $50 million per season, sources told ESPN.

title: Amateur stuns Sinner on way to 1 Point Slam win
content: Sydney amateur Jordan Smith beat defending Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner on his way to claiming the $1 million Australian first prize at the Australian Open's 1 Point Slam.

title: Tiger: 'Incredible' to have Koepka back on tour
content: Speaking a day after Brooks Koepka's return via a new Returning Member Program was announced, Tiger Woods called it "incredible" for the PGA Tour and said he's happy that the five-time major champion will be back this season.

title: Tomlin steps down, not expected to coach in '26
content: Mike Tomlin has stepped down as Steelers coach, ending a 19-year run in Pittsburgh during which he never had a losing season.

title: Ranking all 32 rookie classes in the NFL: There's the top four ... then everybody else
content: How does every NFL team's rookie group stack up? Aaron Schatz ranked all 32 based on first-year production, starting with surprises up top.

title: Our midwinter progress report for all 30 MLB clubs
content: With a lot of work still left to do, here's how the 2026 win projections and playoff odds stand today.

title: Premier League's top 50 transfers of all time: Who is No. 1?
content: What makes a great signing? Is it trophies won, goals scored, a long run of dominance ... or all of the above? Bill Connelly breaks down the best 50 Premier League moves since it began in 1992-93.

title: Who deserves to make the NBA All-Star team: We made 25 picks
content: Locks? Bubble watch? A bonus 25th player?! We're unveiling our 2026 rosters full of legends, first-timers and a few difficult cuts.

title: Nine open NFL coaching jobs, nine predicted hires: Who will land in Baltimore, Pittsburgh, New York?
content: Could three coaches who were just fired immediately find new NFL teams? With interviews taking place this week, we projected candidates to fill open jobs.

title: How Seahawks started over at QB with Sam Darnold and got back to the playoffs
content: It's been 10 months since the Seahawks traded Geno Smith and signed Darnold. Now they're back in the playoffs.

title: Updated NBA mock draft: Projecting who lands at Nos. 1 through 30
content: Which new names enter Jeremy Woo's updated 2026 NBA mock draft and who slid into the top 30 picks or out of the first round?

title: Nine teams that need to turn around their seasons -- now
content: From expected Final Four contenders like Kentucky and beyond, these teams have work to do in the final stretch.

title: Rival leagues, charter flights and T-shirts: 11 moments that led to WNBA labor strife
content: CBA negotiations intensified in recent months, but previous events helped spark the stalemate between the WNBA and WNBPA.

title: How Miami offensive coordinator Shannon Dawson emerged from nowhere
content: The architect of the Hurricane offense began his career grinding for a job at Southeastern Louisiana.

title: Answering the biggest questions regarding Brooks Koepka's return to the PGA Tour
content: How will LIV Golf react? Will other LIV Golf stars follow Koepka back to the PGA Tour? How much will golf fans see Koepka on the PGA Tour this season?

title: What would a Russian Olympic hockey team look like in 2026?
content: The Games will be missing one of the sport's top countries. Here's what the group could have looked like had it been competing.

title: Boxing fights we want to see in 2026: Haney-Garcia 2, Canelo-Benavidez, more
content: A lot of major fights took place in 2025 -- but which megafights do we want to see in the year ahead?

title: Supreme Court takes up transgender athlete cases
content: The Supreme Court got complex arguments and passionate demonstrations as it considered two cases related to transgender athletes.

title: Our favorite bowl game moments: Mascots, mayhem and more
content: Ryan McGee looks back at the wild antics, star turns and emotional times that make the postseason special.

title: Cancelo isn't the center back Flick wanted, but might be the fullback Barça need
content: João Cancelo's return to Barcelona began in confusion, but his loan move for the rest of the season could give the team a boost in a number of ways.

title: Real Madrid fired Xabi Alonso after 233 days. Where did it all go wrong?
content: Alonso returned to Madrid as a club legend and one of the most sought-after coaches around. What happened?

title: NFL divisional round odds, early bets: Seahawks favored vs. 49ers; Rams over Bears
content: Our early bets for the NFL divisional round, plus spreads, lines, totals and FPI analysis for every game.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City prepare Guehi offer
content: Manchester City are readying an offer for Marc Guéhi, and N'Golo Kanté is close to a return to Europe.

title: How to bet on golf in 2026: Expert tips and winning strategies
content: Want to learn how to bet on golf this year? Pamela Maldonado has you covered with everything you need to know.

title: The PGA season is here! Best bets, DFS plays for Sony Open
content: All of the traits bettors should be looking for when golfers take the green at Waialae Country Club this weekend.

title: Dirk linking up with Wagner brothers leads top Magic-Grizz scenes in Europe
content: The Memphis Grizzlies and Orlando Magic crossed the Atlantic this week to play regular-season games in Berlin and London.

title: Temples To Social Media: Mamata Banerjee-Abhishek's 5 Strategies For Bengal
content: The aggressive approach adopted by the BJP has compelled Mamata Banerjee and her nephew Abhishek Banerjee to revisit their political strategy ahead of Bengal elections.

title: "Literally Zero": Musk Says Unaware Of Grok Creating Minors' Explicit Images
content: Elon Musk said on Wednesday he was not aware of any "naked underage images" generated by xAI's Grok chatbot, as scrutiny of the AI tool intensifies worldwide.

title: Warfare Overtakes Armed Conflict As Top Risk: World Economic Forum Survey
content: Economic confrontation between nations and its consequences topped the World Economic Forum's (WEF) annual risks perception survey released on Wednesday.

title: Gold Hits Lifetime High Of Rs 1,46,500 Per 10 Grams, Silver At Record High
content: Silver prices zoomed by Rs 15,000 to a fresh record of Rs 2,86,000 per kg in the national capital on Wednesday, while gold also climbed to touch a lifetime high of Rs 1,46,500 per 10 grams, tracking strong global trends.

title: Karnataka To Hold Joint Legislative Session To Discuss Repeal Of MGNREGA
content: The Karnataka cabinet on Wednesday decided to convene a joint session of the state legislature from January 22 to 31, with a primary focus on the Centre's decision to repeal MGNREGA.

title: Poisoning Suspected As Sweets In Abandoned Bag Kill 3 In Madhya Pradesh
content: The discovery of an unclaimed bag of sweets outside a Public Health Engineering (PHE) office in Junnardeo, Chhindwara, has triggered a chilling mystery that has claimed three lives and left two others hospitalised.

title: Capital Expenditure To Get 10-15% Boost In Budget 2026: Experts
content: The government is likely to maintain its focus on capital expenditure in the upcoming Budget, with a 10-15 per cent increase in the capex target from the current level of Rs 11.21 lakh crore, as private sector players remained cautious.

title: After Trump Threats, An Iran Warning To Neighbours
content: Tehran has warned neighbours hosting US troops that it would hit American bases if Washington strikes, a senior Iranian official told Reuters on Wednesday, as Iran seeks to deter Donald Trump's threats to intervene on behalf of protesters.

title: Couple, Another Woman Killed In Explosion In Jharkhand's Hazaribagh
content: An explosion in Hazaribagh on Wednesday claimed the lives of three people, including a husband and wife and another woman, as per officials.

title: Pro-Pak Slogans Raised At Events Linked To Thackeray Camp: D Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Wednesday launched a scathing attack on Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray, accusing him of indulging in minority appeasement and abandoning the Hindutva ideology.

title: Iran Conducts Gunfire Drills As Trump Threatens Military Action
content: Iran is conducting live gunfire exercises along its Persian Gulf coast and in areas bordering Iraq and Azerbaijan, as Tehran faces mounting pressure from nationwide anti-government protests and the looming threat of US military intervention.

title: Centre Asks Indians To Leave Iran, Advises Against Travelling To Country
content: India on Wednesday asked all its nationals currently residing in Iran to leave by available means as the security situation in the country deteriorated further in view of massive anti-government protests and a crackdown on the demonstrators.

title: "Gross Violation": Russia Says US Is Acting Unreliably By Threatening Iran
content: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Wednesday that the United States was fragmenting the very international system which Washington helped to create.

title: Trinamool, Probe Agency Petitions Over I-PAC Dismissed, Over To Top Court
content: The tit-for-tat petitions filed by the Enforcement Directorate and West Bengal's ruling Trinamool Congress in connection with the raids on the party's election consultancy firm I-PAC were dismissed by the Calcutta High Court today.

title: Singapore Cops Say Zubeen Garg Not Murdered, Declined Life Jacket: Report
content: Popular singer-songwriter Zubeen Garg, who drowned in Singapore last September, declined a life jacket, a coroner's court in Singapore was told on Wednesday.

title: US Moves Personnel At Qatar Base As Iran Tensions Rise: Report
content: Some personnel have been advised to leave the US military's Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar by Wednesday evening, three diplomats told Reuters, amid warnings from Washington that it could intervene to protect protesters in Iran.

title: France Bans 10 British Far-Right Activists Over Anti-Migrant Actions
content: France has banned ten British far-right activists for actions in France intended to stop migrants crossing to the United Kingdom on small boats, the French interior ministry said Wednesday.

title: Teenager Gang-Raped By Pak Grooming Gang In London, 200 Sikhs Rescue Her
content: In an unsettling incident in Hounslow, West London, 200 members of the Sikh community gathered chanting, "Jo Bole So Nihaal, Sat Sri Akal," to rescue a 16-year-old girl held captive by a man in his late 30s.

title: Yunus Says Bangladesh Polls On Schedule As Attacks On Minorities Continue
content: Amidst worries of delay in elections in Bangladesh, Chief Adviser of the Interim Government in Bangladesh, Muhammad Yunus, has reiterated that "No matter who says what, elections will be held on February 12, not a day before, not a day after."

title: Farmers’ march led by Hanuman Beniwal to Jaipur called off after high-voltage drama
content: Mr. Beniwal, critical of the BJP government in the State, says the dharna at Riyan Badi had sent across a ‘historic message’ to the government to render justice to the people waiting for resolution of their grievances

title: Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu stresses NDA government’s commitment to safeguarding and propagating Telugu traditions
content: At the Bhogi celebrations conducted at his ancestral village at Naravaripalle, he highlights the importance of tracing one’s cultural roots

title: Kerala School Kalolsavam 2026: Classical wit meets contemporary pulse as young satirists take centre stage
content: Performances at the school arts festival reaffirms that Kerala’s classical art forms continue to evolve, engage, and entertain — gracefully bridging tradition with the pulse of the present

title: Shiv Sena leader seeks action against police officer for misleading court
content: The demand by religious head Siddalinga Swami comes after a court penalises Somaling Kiradalli for furnishing false information

title: SIT to probe replacement of Sabarimala flagstaff
content: The flagstaff at the Sabarimala temple was replaced in 2017, during the tenure of Prayar Gopalakrishnan as Travancore Devaswom Board president. The decision had then been taken as the old flagstaff had deteriorated significantly due to wear and tear

title: Tamil Nadu | Pongal, jaggery and a vanishing tradition
content: Crop disease and changing manufacturing techniques are threatening the GI-tagged jaggery from Veeramangudi in Thanjavur

title: Ground reality at Brahmapuram far removed from rosy picture painted by previous council: Kochi Mayor
content: The reality is that the reclaimed stretch of land is no longer usable, as it has been permeated by river water due to biomining at a depth of 3.5 feet. To reclaim it again, we will need to fill up that stretch, says Mayor

title: Kollam Vigilance Court denies bail to Unnikrishnan Potti
content: Remand period of K.S. Baiju, S. Sreekumar, Pankaj Bhandari, and Govardhan, other accused in the case, extended till January 28

title: Prime Minister Modi’s wishes on my induction into ‘Kenjutsu’ inspiring, says Pawan Kalyan
content: I will strive even harder to serve Bharat and inspire the younger generation to live with discipline, honour our heritage, and work fearlessly for the nation, says the Deputy Chief Minister

title: No demand for source code, say phone makers
content: Industry body MAIT pointed out that the government mandate was amended to remove the language last June itself

title: NGT notice to U.P., M.P., Rajasthan governments over ‘serious health issues’ due to sewage in drinking water
content: The NGT has issued notices to all three State governments and other agencies to file their affidavits on the matter

title: Brahmapuram becomes new flashpoint in UDF-LDF rivalry
content: Mayor V.K. Minimol accuses the LDF of misleading the public about the real state of affairs at Brahmapuram, the seat of waste management projects

title: Elderly man ‘attempts suicide’ near Naidu’s residence at Naravaripalle
content: He was reportedly upset at not being able to handover a representation to the Chief Minister on some land-related issue

title: Procedural glitches delay construction of new building for city school in Kozhikode
content: Classes are now being conducted in age-old buildings that are in a dilapidated condition. Over 1,500 children are studying in the school

title: Thousands witness Makaravilakku at Sabarimala
content: The entire pilgrimage zone, including the surrounding hills, had been packed with devotees for days, all eagerly awaiting the twilight spectacle. Rooftops of buildings, east-facing hillsides, and grasslands within the Sabarimala forest area were occupied by pilgrims seeking vantage points to witness the event.

title: Meghalaya group seeks PM’s help to uproot illegal settlements
content: The Garoland State Movement Committee said the killing of an indigenous youth by suspected Bangladeshi nationals highlights the grave humanitarian and constitutional crisis for the State’s tribal people

title: Bhogi festive fervour engulfs Chittoor rural side
content: Kuppam, Palamaner, Chittoor, Nagari in Chitoor district, and Madanapalle, Rayachoti, and Piler in neighbouring Annamayya district witnesses the festivities in full swing

title: ACME solar power project in Anantapur makes tangible progress on the ground
content: From getting government clearance to construction, the ₹3,000-crore, 400-MW project’s execution in four months is a reflection of the State government’s commitment to fast-tracking clean energy investments, says HRD Minister Lokesh

title: Joint session of Legislature from Jan. 22 to have special discussion on VB G RAM G
content: One of the resolutions of the Cabinet is to create awareness on the social and economic impact on the society that the new legislation could bring, says H.K. Patil

title: First deck slab of Anna Salai flyover placed
content: Around 98% of the work to lay foundations have been completed and the steel barricades have been moved for a length of 1.5 km

title: 800 students participate in KLETU engineering innovation exhibitions
content: Prayog Hemanth 2026 and Avinya Hemanth 2026 were organised by the Centre for Engineering Education Research in Hubballi

title: Supreme Court schedules plea for passive euthanasia of man for 'final order' on January 15 after judges meet family
content: The family feels that if the medical treatment is not making any difference, then there is no point in continuing with such treatment and making Harish Rana suffer for no good reason, the Bench of Justices J.B. Pardiwala and K.V. Viswanathan stated

title: Signature campaign manages to save 70-year-old tamarind tree in Kolkata
content: The tree, home to numerous varieties of birds, was planted in her compound by revolutionary Parul Mukherjee when she came to settle in a refugee colony in south Kolkata about 70 years ago

title: Two facing disciplinary proceedings for illegal access of memory card in actor rape case
content: Mahesh Mohan, the personal assistant to the former Ernakulam Principal and Sessions Judge Kauser Edappagath, and Thajudeen, the former Shirasthadar of the CBI Court 3, where the trial in the rape case was conducted, are facing the proceedings initiated by the Kerala High Court

title: ‘Suvasini Puja’ gets into Guinness Book of Records
content: A whopping 10,000 married women gathered at the Sri Venkateswara University Tarakarama Stadium and lit oil wick lamps on January 6 as part of the ritual

title: AAP claims 4.5 crore names removed from UP voter list; wants Supreme Court to take cognisance
content: Senior AAP leader and Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh accused the State government and Election Commission officials of orchestrating "the largest electoral fraud in UP's history under the name of SIR"

title: Inquiry panel to look into lapses that led to kidnap of children from school
content: Two children were kidnapped during school hours at Kamalapur in Dharwad; they were later rescued following a road accident

title: Two held for forging Collector’s signature in Vellore
content: Selvan reportedly forged the signature of District Collector and issued a NOC to get DTCP approval from the civic body

title: Hyderabad Metro Rail to purchase 60 coaches ahead of phase two approval
content: The government is also trying to address issues related to common ticketing, first and last-mile connectivity and upkeep of street furniture below metro stations, says HMR managing director

title: Silk kite, replica of Diamond DA62 propeller aircraft gifted to German Chancellor Merz
content: Combining German aeronautical design with Indian metalworking expertise, the artefact represents cooperation, shared values and a strong, evolving partnership between the two nations, the officials said

title: Man arrested for chopping wife’s hand in Ranipet
content: Police said Arumugam came home drunk and quarreled with his wife when she insisted that he does not consume alcohol anymore

title: Police launch investigation, as three Belagavi youths escape from cyber slavery in Cambodia
content: The youths escaped from Cambodia with help from the Belagavi Police, the CBI and the law enforcement authorities in Cambodia

title: Yaduveer Krishnadatta Chamaraja Wadiyar bats for flyover at Manipal Hospital junction, EV cluster in Mysuru
content: MP says the construction of the flyover would prove to be a milestone for Mysuru, as it would help reduce road accidents, cut travel time, ease congestion, and ensure smoother entry and exit to the city. The NHAI Chief Secretary reportedly responded positively to the proposal

title: INTACH raises concerns over conservation work at 15th-century Aali Masjid in Kashmir
content: The mosque is “losing its historical and architectural character” because of the latest intervention initiated by the Jammu and Kashmir Government, INTACH said

title: Govinda Rao takes charge as TUDA Vice-Chairman
content: The 2018 batch IAS officer also assumes full additional charge as Joint Collector of Tirupati district

title: Ambalappuzha Petta Thullal group alleges mistreatment by police at Sabarimala
content: According to a complaint lodged, Periyon Gopalakrishna Pillai, Ambalappuzha Petta Thullal group’s leader, fell and sustained injuries after being pushed by the police near the holy 18 steps

title: Congress leader courts controversy over alleged support to Rahul Mamkootathil
content: Sreenadevi Kunjamma, who represents the Pallickal division in the Pathanamthitta district panchayat, appeared live on her social media page, questioning some of the claims made by a woman who filed a rape case against the MLA

title: Devotees witness annual Mailara fair in Yadgir
content: The idol of the main deity was brought in a palanquin for a holy dip amid continuous chanting of Elu Koti Elu Kotige by devotees and then, taken back

title: Aditya Sahu elected new president of Jharkhand BJP, seeks to protect tribal rights

title: KDP leader Mani Kappan meets IUML national general secretary, rules out giving up Pala Assembly seat
content: During the half-hour meeting, Kappan is learnt to have requested the IUML leader to consider swapping the Elathur seat with Perambra.

title: After rally, Kuki-Zos stick to union territory demand
content: The apex civil body of the tribes also warned against resettling internally displaced persons belonging to the Meitei community close to the Kuki-Zo areas

title: AP-Genco plans to set up a Small Modular Reactor to diversify its energy mix
content: Aim is to make a sustained contribution to the State’s power requirement with as much less carbon footprint as possible, says MD Nagalakshmi, while laying emphasis on completing the slew of Pumped Storage Hydropower Plants and maintaining the efficiency of Thermal Power Plants

title: Foresters seize two tusks in Vellore; three youth held

title: Delayed flowering cycle worries mango growers in Chittoor
content: Field officials of the Horticulture department attribute the adverse conditions to unseasonal rains in eastern side of the district, and prolonged winter conditions and erratic temperature fluctuations in the western mandals

title: Zubeen Garg's death: Singer was drunk, had declined life jacket, Coroner’s court told in Singapore

title: Lokpal scraps corruption complaint against BJP MP Nishikant Dubey

title: Cybersecurity, income inequality & insufficient public services the top risks in India in 2026: World Economic Forum

title: Blast in Jharkhand's Hazaribag kills at least two; one injured

title: Orioles to debut Tupac Shakur bobblehead against Athletics
content: a prominent figure on the west coast rap scene, the legendary rapper moved to Baltimore from the Bronx in 1985 . he went to middle school and high school in Baltimore before moving to Marin City, Calif. in 1988 . on may 8th, we're celebrating the life and legacy of legendary rapper and actor Tupac Shakur .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks remain Super Bowl favorites; Patriots now AFC front-runner
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the  Super Bowl . The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams , who advanced to the divisional round with a win on Saturday.  The  New England Patriots  and  Buffalo Bills  are now the top two favorites in the AFC after advancing to the Divisional round on Sunday. The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the fifth-best odds to win the Super Bowl despite being the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, had a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.

title: 'How many tackles can one man break!?' Remembering Tommie Frazier and the greatest run in national title history
content: quarterback Tommie Frazier scores a touchdown in the 1996 cornhuskers' win . he ducked under a defensive end late in the third quarter of the 1995 national championship . nine Gators got a hand on Frazier, but none could bring him down .

title: 🏈 Transfer portal: Teams that found best fits

title: Passan's teams winning the MLB offseason so far -- and those that need to make a big move soon
